title: 111_s3355
content: The "Veterans One Source Act of 2010" establishes a one-stop internet website for information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities for veterans and their families and caregivers. Congress finds that veterans and their families lack easily accessible information on benefits and resources. The Department of Veterans Affairs aims to modernize and streamline services, including using the internet for outreach to the veteran community. The lack of a comprehensive, user-friendly internet website with all necessary information on benefits, resources, and services for veterans and their families hinders the smooth transition from military to civilian life. Veterans seek personalized assistance from the Department of Veterans Affairs. The Department of Defense has successfully implemented interactive online tools for members of the Armed Forces, such as Military One Source. A consolidated and interactive Internet website is needed for the veterans community to streamline access to information and benefits. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a single, consolidated, expanded, and interactive Internet website to provide information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities for veterans and their families and caregivers. The Secretary may contract with a Federal or private entity to create and maintain a website consolidating information on benefits for veterans. The website will integrate dynamic features to provide a personalized and interactive experience for veterans and their families. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may utilize an existing website, like the National Resource Directory, to establish a personalized and interactive Internet experience for veterans. Consultation with various departments will ensure interoperability and collaborative information sharing. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may collaborate with various federal officials, advisory committees, and organizations to establish an interactive Internet website for veterans. The website may include tools from the Department of Defense, Department of Labor, Department of Education, Internal Revenue Service, Social Security Administration, Small Business Administration, and other relevant entities. Additionally, representatives specified in title 38 of the United States Code may also be involved in the website's development. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs may establish an Internet website in the ".com" domain to serve as a comprehensive resource for veterans and their families. The website will provide information on benefits, resources, services, and opportunities available to veterans. The benefits, resources, services, and opportunities described in subsection (d) include veterans benefits from various departments such as Veterans Affairs, Labor, and Small Business Administration, as well as tax benefits and social security benefits. The benefits, resources, services, and opportunities for veterans include tax benefits, social security benefits, veterans benefits provided by the Small Business Administration, resources for families, child care, home care, caregivers, education professionals, mental health professionals, stress management, veterans service organizations, State and local resources, and discounts available to veterans. The website for veterans provides resources on veterans service organizations, State and local resources, discounts, volunteer opportunities, community events, and other relevant information as determined by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. Assistance is also available for applying for benefits and resources, as well as additional benefits, services, and opportunities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The website for veterans offers assistance in applying for benefits and resources, as well as interactive features such as virtual guides, peer-to-peer discussions, ride-sharing information, and internet applications. Additional benefits, services, and opportunities are also provided as deemed appropriate by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs includes interactive features on the website, along with plans to enhance it for better information on benefits and services in biennial reports on outreach activities. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs includes interactive features on the website to enhance information on benefits and services, as reported in biennial reports on outreach activities.
